text: Hypoxic induction of <extra_id_0> interleukin-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in human endothelial cells .

text: Because leukocyte - mediated tissue damage is an important component of the pathologic picture in ischemia / reperfusion , we have sought mechanisms by which PMNs are directed into hypoxic tissue .

Incubation of human endothelial cells ( ECs ) in hypoxia , PO2 approximately 14-18 Torr , led to time - dependent release of <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antigen into the conditioned medium ; this was accompanied by increased chemotactic activity for PMNs , blocked by antibody to <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Production of <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by hypoxic ECs occurred concomitantly with both increased levels of <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA , based on polymerase chain reaction analysis , and increased <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription , based on nuclear run-on assays .

text: Northern analysis of mRNA from hypoxic ECs also demonstrated increased levels of mRNA for <extra_id_0> macrophage chemotactic protein-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , another member of the chemokine superfamily of proinflammatory cytokines .

text: <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene induction was associated with the presence of increased binding activity in nuclear extracts from hypoxic ECs for the NF-kB site .
Studies with human umbilical vein segments exposed to hypoxia also demonstrated increased elaboration of <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antigen compared with normoxic controls .

In mice exposed to hypoxia ( PO2 approximately 30-40 Torr ) , there was increased pulmonary leukostasis , as evidenced by increased <extra_id_0> myeloperoxidase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity in tissue homogenates .

In parallel , increased levels of transcripts for <extra_id_0> IP-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a murine homologue in the chemokine family related to <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , were observed in hypoxic lung tissue .
Taken together , these data suggest that hypoxia constitutes a stimulus for leukocyte chemotaxis and tissue leukostasis .
